description:
I guess you can say this is a bias review! BUT every time I am in this coffee shop I always receive great customer service and decent (on busy days) to amazing in awe (nonbusy days) quality cups of coffee or hot chocolate. 

It's the first coffee shop open when I get here around 5 am to start setting up for the farmers market and it stays open until I leave around 2 pm. So I know I will be able to go back and get refills on quality coffee while I'm working. 

The shop is small, but clean. Limited seating and space due to the small shop size but the tables and bars are actually set up strategically to maximize the little space they have. 

I would compare the pricing to that of Starbucks. It is a little pricey, but hey it's San Francisco. 

Ambiance is more of a grab and go type of coffee shop and yes! They do provide free WiFi. 

I never stop here for my breakfast food, but they do provide cups of parfaits and bagels and other various breakfast items. 

Overall, not bad.
author: Daw M.

description:
I've been coming here for a few months and today I thought I'd try something new. I asked the barista if I should have the matcha latte or chai she said matcha is very good, so I ordered it.. once I took my first sip it was still chunky powder and did not taste good. I went up to her and said this drink isn't for me I don't like it may I get another drink. I got the iced chai.. and they charged me for it. So I had to pay for two drinks and only drank one. 

I've worked in service industry for a while and if someone only took one sip and didn't like your recommendation, I don't see why you would have to pay for another drink.. $10 later I have my small iced chai. Pretty upset with the service
author: Kailee B.

description:
Gee, I didn't know Cumaica was a family-run operation with deep Nicaraguan roots. I also didn't know it was an offshoot of the local Martha & Bros chain. Apparently the original owners thought the brand needed a splooge of marketing pizzazz since I frankly agree that the folksy name is probably too vintage for the caffeinated hipsters who they want to attract. I've been to the Cumaica closer to my home in SoMa just a couple of times because Blue Bottle, Coffee Cultures, and even Peet's draw my attention more, and all are just a few yards away from each other at 10th and Mission.

This Cumaica has the benefit of having a more prominent location on Clement in the more family-friendly Inner Richmond where Blue Danube appears to be its closest competition. My impression was the same as the Mission location - friendly service and middling drip coffee at a good price - $2 for a Medium House Blend (photo: http://bit.ly/2NuZjzn). The counter was overwhelmed with baked items under glass (photo: http://bit.ly/2CDqrIp) though for my money, I'd rather walk up to Ariscault and get one of their amazing croissants. The seating is somewhat sparse in here, but there is a welcome parklet right outside the door.

COFFEE - 3 stars...if you need decent coffee, they have it
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...well-kept though somewhat claustrophobic, the parklet provides relief
SERVICE - 4 stars...where they excel
TOTAL - 3 stars...Martha, I hardly knew ya

RELATED - Looking for a cup of coffee in a café? Here's a list of places I've tried and reviewed in San Francisco: http://bit.ly/2v6aa8D
author: Ed U.

description: So glad to find Cumaica Coffee right here at 2nd Avenue and Clement.  Did you know that Cumaica is a family-run operation with deep Nicaraguan roots. Convenient location and easier to park around before getting into the thick of all the stores, restaurants, and vegetable stands once you hit 4th Avenue.  The coffee is fantastic.  I only get coffee at Roasteries.  The prices are good.  Susan who is usually the one handling orders and making the coffee is a sweetheart.  5 Stars.
author: Bree B.

description: Terrible coffee. My cappucino tasted awful had To throw away Who has time for A bad coffee?
author: Angelina P.

description:
I like visiting this place whenever I'm in the neighborhood because I can't get enough of their matcha frapp! It's so good! It's probably the best matcha frapp I've had so far in the city.

Customer service is ok. It's not the best, but I like their matcha frapp enough that the service here isn't a deal breaker for me. I also usually go in the late afternoon when they aren't too busy.

I like that it's a small place and it's clean. I've seen quite a few people reading or using their laptops inside. So, it could be a decent spot to hangout for a little bit.
author: Fallon P.

description: Decent place, cappucino wasn't tiny and my fiancee enjoyed her iced latte. In and out quickly. Cute interior and the service seemed decent. We took our order to-go so don't have much to say about it. Their coffee menu is pretty wide-ranging. If I'm back in the Richmond I'd probably swing by here over other coffee places.
author: Samir K.

description: first time here and they provided quick and friendly service in a great little neighborhood
author: Alex H.

description: The people that work here are the nicest. Ta my neighborhood coffee spot and go-to for a solid latte and quick egg and cheese bagel sandwich. Can't complain.
author: Christina O.

description:
Getting my morning Joe. 
A friendly staff and reasonable price. 
Nice way to start my day.
author: Austin L.

description:
Be very careful with their drip coffee. My lid came off, and the coffee that spilled on my hand resulted in a large 3rd degree burn. I won't go into gory details, but was a serious injury that took months to heal and is still discolored 7 months later. 

After some quick research I found that there's no good reason to keep coffee that hot. If management reads these reviews, I suggest turning that temp down about 30 degrees and avoid serving coffee at boiling temperatures.
author: Aaron K.

description: Just fyi, their iced matcha green tea is a sweetened milky drink. Not a clean iced green tea as the name would imply.   I really wish i would have known i was getting a "matche latte" or whatever before i payed $5 for it.  Look up matche online.  No where is it a milk drink.  Its green tea powder.  Plain and simple. Please specify this on your menu maybe?
author: Ryder D.

description: Found this place while waiting for a school tour.  Very nice little coffee shop. First, the coffee was good.  They had ample seating and tables.  They also had wifi ask for code when you order. There was a bathroom and it was clean. Then on top of all that the workers were very hospitable. This is a perfect place to get some studying or remote work done.  I would like to give it a 4.5 star. The only reason I don't give it a 5 is I'm quite anal when it comes to my coffee. Their coffee was good but fell a little short for me.   It just didn't have the notes you would get with pour over w/ quality beans. Having said that, I'll still come back b/c positives far out weigh the one minor negative.
author: Mike S.

description: Genuinely good! Great people, great coffee, great day starter!
author: I Am G.

description: My cappuccino tasted so burnt and rancid that I couldn't drink it. The espresso shots were just not pulled right.
author: Marilynn L.

description: My top of the morning is this place to go first. Ice vanilla latte and their garlic bagel with turkey/avocado/cucumber and tomato is delicious. I know that there are two more other places but this is the best one. Employees always remember you and very good about what drink you buy. Smile are a welcome site but once again. This location only. Parking in the morning is awesome but late afternoon is shit. I am happy that I found this place accidentally. Love them!!!
author: S F.

description:
Almost each morning, for the past year, I have got a gotten a coffee/latte at Cumaica on Clement Street. I've never found a working group of people that are so kind, dedicated to their work, and friendly with their customers. I look forward to seeing Anna, Ramona, Michele, Carolina and Anselmo each time I walk in. Each one of the staff members is knowledgable about their products and values their seasoned and new customers. E

Every time I walk in, I am greeted with a warm welcome by each one of the staff and before I know it - they are making me my favorite drink without me even saying so. Simply, the best service. The espresso and coffee is rich and made to perfection. The pastries and bagel sandwiches are the very best! When I move, I will miss my favorite local coffee shop with people I've know known to be my friends. Thanks Cumaica - and more specifically Anselmo, Anna, Ramona, Michelle and Carolina - for your work!
author: Abigail M.

description: I come here probably once a week. Small coffee shop with a few tables indoors and a bench outdoors. They have decent coffee but don't expect amazing service. The workers are there to just make your beverage and give it to you. Don't expect a smile or chit chat. The serve the best white mocha, hot or iced! It's my go to if I'm craving something sweet. All their drinks are double shot. I just recently tried their matcha latte. It's just ok. I think I'll stick with my mocha or regular coffee.
author: Jennalyn L.

description: They built a nice parklet but the coffee tastes burnt and the owner is rude. Tip: you can bring a to-go coffee from anywhere you want and enjoy it in the parklet---it's on public land.
author: A R.

description:
The espresso and pastries were tasty, and space is relaxing and warm, and the baristas were quick and friendly. 
However, I come to coffee shops to work on my laptop most often, and Cumaica limits your internet usage based on how much you purchase. 35 minutes for a $2.25 purchase and 150 minutes for a $10.25 purchase. Will most likely not be back because of the wifi limit.
author: Kat S.

description:
I wish they had one in SoCal, I'd be here everyday. The drinks are extremely cheap for SF standards and they offer nice pastries and bagels as well. There are many workers so you receive your drinks pretty quickly. 

I love how the price difference between sizes are only about 25 cents. 

They have free wifi and a gigantic bathroom. It's not the most beautiful cafe in the area, but just what you need after a nice meal.
author: Cam C.

description:
We were walking back to our car from having breakfast at Eats when we saw this cute cafe. It was enough to convince myself that a cup of coffee was what I wanted even after being full from breakfast. 

My daughter had the Mexican hot chocolate and I had a soy latte. We both enjoyed it. Staff was very friendly! If I'm in the area, I'll come back. No stars to knock off at all.
author: Lani S.

description:
The wifi here almost never works. I had ONE experience where it worked well for me. I didn't mind the timed option (based on how much you spend), because that was the only time it performed. It's a tiny place, space is at a premium and the business needs to make money--I'm fine with that. I was there this week to do some work and found they had changed it back to a non-timed option and I couldn't connect to the Internet. I've stopped coming here on a regular basis because of this. I looked around and found that others were having the same issue. We all left about the same time. Maybe the wifi issue is designed to keep the seats turning over? Whatever the reason, it's a bummer for me, especially if I've carried my laptop there specifically to do a bit of work. 

I've been here quite a bit over the years and I've found service to be efficient and pleasant. The coffee is quite bitter for me, but it's not terrible. A nice offering of sweet and savory options. It won't rock your world, but it's fine overall. It's a good option if you want to grab and go.
author: Jules M.

description: I've been here twice since coffee shops are pretty rare on Clement St. This place is popular the times I've went due to the farmer's market. I've gotten latte from this place and it's a-ok. Not like those specialty coffees where the coffee is strong enough. Too bad I'm not really feeling this place since I'm usually around the neighborhood.
author: Claire J.

description: Love their matcha latte! One of the best I've tried in the city. Their baked goods are yummy too.
author: Alice C.

description: If you can blow my mind with a simple iced Americano, then yea, you have my attention. Seating inside is okay. I would kick it under the sun out front with their reclaimed wood and succulent benches. Art  and design magazines and you're good.
author: Joy A.

description: This cafe is ridiculous. Why would you only give internet access for 35 minutes for a customer who bought a small coffee? When I asked the cashier about it, she said your time limit depends on what you buy. Thankfully she gave me another receipt for 1 more hour after I complained. However, I was annoyed again later when she said they're closing at 6pm, when she said they're closing at 6:30 originally. I think one lady is the owner and it's up to her what time they close. I suspect she changed her mind later. I felt annoyed because this earlier time cause me to not be able to finish filing my taxes. I also felt ripped off for paying $2.25 for apple cider when I suspect that it was just hot water with powder instead of the real cider made from cinnamon stick. I'm not coming here again. The Spanish music doesn't help either.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
This music is so horrible it's driving me insane. The fidelity is lower than 60 kbps which means it was ripped from a rip of a rip from an illegally downloaded MP3. Auto-tuned Mexican B-list artists off the street. Just get a Spotify account people, it only costs 2.5 cups of coffee.

However, the barista was very sweet. I didn't have the heart to tell her how repulsive her taste in music is, so I turned to the Internet. Sorry / you're welcome.
author: Jesse W.

description:
Used to go here many times per week. 

And then the comfy bench out front where you could relax and sip your latte broke. And the owners have left it broken. That was six months ago.
author: Shawn K.

description: Great! sweet ladies great food unique creative delicious
author: Thurston T.

description:
One can get coffee anywhere in San Francisco, but Cumaica in the Richmond is different. Its the wonderful staff that makes the difference! They are always friendly and even more, they know most of their customers names.
From the moment you walk in the door you feel that the staff is enjoying what they do and the interaction with their customers is genuine and engaging.
Bravo!
author: Russ E.

description:
I absolutely love their coffee, their coffee has a very rich flavor too it, which separates them from my usual San Francisco coffee roasters (Philz, coffee bar, four barrel). Very warm and inviting ambiance with nice eclectic art throughout. Plenty of seating and in the ever convenient Clement area. Great place to come to of you find yourself stuck waiting for a seat at Burma Superstar.

All in all, if I lived nearby, if be here every morning. Philz/four barrel/coffee bar who?
author: Aaron C.

description: 5PM: walk in and ask if they have wifi as I have a meeting. 3 people behind the counter confirm and I make my purchase. The wifi is down and I ask them to unplug and re connect. I am met with laughter and lack of care. I live half a block from this establishment and will not be returning. So many other good options in the area.
author: Robert S.

description: A quaint little coffee shop with good coffee and sweet ladies behind the counter.
author: Anthony W.

description: This is quality and affordable coffee place I like the latte very much ,place is clean low key and service is nice !
author: Fabio T.

description: Do not come here if you want to work on something. They limit your wifi usage to 55 mins.
author: Ricky V.

description:
Coffee good solid strong
Omg the morning glory bread yum yum yum
Service always friendly and it's got a park let outside which is nice.
author: obgyn K.

description:
Cumaica is small. most of it's seating is on benches alongside the walls.

pour: (m. 2)
-dark roast on the harsh side, coffee not so flavorful nor bold.
-strong coffee. cream would soften the edge.

drips:
-service was polite, inquisitive( do you want anything else?)
-snacks available also.
-meter parking in front.
author: Victor G.

description:
My Mexican Mocha was really solid. Well made, hot enough but not-too-hot. The seating area is a bit small and on a Saturday evening there wasn't a free spot. However, the guy making my coffee/counter person was really nice. Cute but non-descript little cafe.

The bathrooms are clean, which adds another star for me.
author: Bianca U.

description: Cute little neighborhood shop. Good variety of the normal menu but the space is a bit on the smaller side. Crowded on weekends but nice to come study or hang out on weekdays.
author: Emily F.

description:
Strong non fat lattes, LOL.

Come often on Saturdays, last weekend they were playing 80's music!!!  AWESOME!!!

Great staff as well!!!
author: Kevin L.

description:
Mighty Leaf tea,
Italian sodas (although they use too much Torani syrup)
and passable coffee (based off other reviews)

decent enough to pass the time whilst waiting for a table at either B Star or Burma

they use Stampt so if you have the app, don't forget to get scan the barcode
author: Susy C.

description:
The staff is very nice and friendly. Small place though. Their drinks are pretty good.

-1 Star though for closing at 8PM :(
author: Anonymous ?.

description:
The hot chocolate is good, and people who work here are very nice.

The physical layout inside is really a mess.  It makes things feel more harried and complicated than they need to be.  I normally hate the tall window counter spots, but those are the best ones at Cumaica, sadly.

The true measure of a coffeehouse is whether I would enjoy spending time here reading, people-watching, and writing (in that order).  Sadly, I wouldn't.
author: John S.

description: My favorite coffee in all of SF. I drive from afar to have a cup of joe from this place. The staff is kind and warm, they take the time to get to know each of their regular customers.
author: tina l.

description: This review is for Sunday March 13, by far one of the most rude barista I've ever encountered. Due to the fact of ordering a few drinks,  I restated my order to her  (the short skinny barista, (since they don't wear name tags) and she shun me off basically telling me to shut up because she knows how to do her job. Next thing you know she got my order wrong so I told her this is incorrect.  She gave by far the worst attitude and started throwing and slamming things. She remade the order and I clearly ask her "is this quad shot" like what I paid for,  she said yes (not to mention with an attitude) and then she put the drink on the counter and look away speaking in another language.  I even took a picture of 2 of the 3 drinks, apparently a quad shot is lighter then triple shot and both being white mochas. Anyhow never coming back to this place and sucks for them since I always order coffee for my staff. The cashier was extremely nice and professional though!
author: Salim S.

description:
Best white mochas in the city (especially iced). Don't know what they do different but I don't ever get an white mocha from anywhere else.
And very nice baristas.
author: Brooke F.

description: I really love the house blend coffee here. They also have breakfast burritos that will really start you off on the right note. I like the black bean and cheese one. Yes, they are pricey, but quality.
author: Rosie G.

description:
I've had a couple of work meetings here and it's a solid spot for that. It's not a big space but there are some tables and nice counters by the windows that can function as decent work stations. 

The coffee is good. I've ordered lattes here and they've been perfect. I had a breakfast burrito here the last time which is pre made and then nuked in the microwave. I usually don't like that but it was tasty enough to make it worthwhile. I'd order one again. 

The people who work here are nice, always smiling, helpful, friendly. 

Good neighborhood spot for good coffee!
author: Jessica C.

description:
Was on Clement killing some time before an appointment last month when I noticed that Martha Bros. had been replaced by this new coffee shop. I decided to stop in for an iced coffee and do some studying. Cumaica is clean, plain and simple on the inside, with a very straightforward and easy-to-read menu. My coffee was cheap, strong, and solid, and I sipped it as I studied slash people-watched from a high table and barstool at the window. It was very conducive to getting work done.

I was intrigued by their logo, "Artesanos Del Cafe," though there wasn't really anything else in the place to suggest a Latin influence. From Cumaica's website I've learned that the owners' parents grew up on a coffeebean farm in Nicaragua and that they get their coffee from local farms that are similar. I definitely hope they add more of a Nicaraguan vibe to the shop, or at least draw attention to the uniqueness of their business, in the future. I have a feeling they're still working out the kinks as they just opened. Four locations in San Francisco so far: Clement, Pac. Heights, SoMa and Excelsior.
author: Kate V.

description:
This is right around the corner from my house, so great location :)   I go in, get my coffee and am happy.  The staff has always been really friendly and sometimes funny.  The drip coffees/ lattes are pretty good.   Its usually pretty crowded when I go, but when I wanted to sit and relax a while, they did have a table.  

And I am very happy they have bagels with hummus!
author: Erin W.

description: Their coffee is decent enough, which is why I have come here several times. The staff aren't really friendly here, but that's not what I come here for anyway. I wouldn't come here to study. Sometimes their wifi is down and when its up, you only get 1 hr before getting kicked off. It's the only coffee shop I have gone to recently that times you out. So weird. The pastries are sometimes pretty stale.  Overall, not a warm inviting environment. There are a ton of better coffee shops in the area, in my opinion.
author: N N.

description:
Ellie, Ramona and Anselmo are the best!
Always friendly, and fast - they know what they are doing - EXCELLENT SERVICE-
Best coffee and scones in SF- their great attitudes make it even better.
author: susan c.

description:
Very often they close earlier than the posted hours (as early as 6pm). It's happened to me at least 5 times now (including today, a Saturday). It's frustrating! It wasn't until I sat down shortly for 10 minutes that they told me they are closing soon. They should have posted a sign or notify patrons before ringing them up. If I knew I would've opted for a place where I can sit and relax. :(

Otherwise, the coffee is decent and the baristas are friendly.
author: Mei H.

description:
Very nice employees and a great location right on a sunny corner of Clement.  Great outdoor seating and a cozy parklet right out front.  
However, their coffee beans are almost always over-roasted.  A shot of espresso here is strong, but more often than not tastes burnt.  Plus, for a Latin-themed cafe, the music playing is usually annoying top-40 pop.  
For a quick coffee-to-go and friendly service, I'd recommend Cumaica.  But for a delicious cappuccino and a relaxing environment, you may want to look elsewhere.
author: Alexander T.

description:
The friendliest coffee shop in SF.  They quickly learn your name and drink.  Good coffee, stays hot, lots of yummy goodies.  Still keeping the cost of a small coffee under 2$

I look forward to walking in every morning before work!
author: Chelsey G.

description:
I was visiting Clement St after breakfast at Eats and noticed Cumaica. Great selection of coffees and snacks. Small with about seating for 20 people but it brings some nice cafe charm to this area without as many cafe options as other parts of the city. The soy chai is fantastic too!

A fairly expansive menu, and the pre-made food in their deli case look really appetizing and healthy.
A great addition to the neighborhood!
author: Kathy K.

description: String house brew (check!). Great to sit on Sun and see the lively Farmer's Market in front (check!). Wifi (check!). Good music (check!). Power outlets for laptop slaves (check!). Feels super local and friendly (check!)
author: Modesta N.

description: I love this place, staff is super friendly and greet you by your name every time you stop for your cup of coffee. I prefer this over Peet's. Anselmo, Eli & Mona are the best baristas I've ever met.
author: Jesse R.

description:
Beautiful, latte art on my vanilla latte, every time! The foam was frothed perfectly all the way to the rim of the cup.

Very friendly staff who always greet you with a smile.

Their bagel with cream cheese is perfectly toasted. I like to add butter to it as well which gives the bagel a bit more enjoyable.

This location is one of the better coffee shops in the neighborhood.
author: Nancy N.

description: Learned that Cumaica is a city in Nicaragua.  Stopped by after grabbing brunch at B Star Bar.  Workers are friendly.  They have also have almond milk.  I think the lattes are rich.  Good coffee spot in this section of the Richmond.
author: Dorothy L.

description:
Had a great carrot cake. 
This is a very nice neighborhood cafe. It's a bit small, so during peak hours seating might be an issue.
author: Yann L.

description: Small but nice selection of pastries. House coffee was not my kind of bean, but it was brewed very well. (I'm a steadfast drinker of Sumatra and similar beans.) Nice, clean interior. Latin music flowing throughout.  If there was anything I'd change it would be to have open WiFi rather than a connection time based upon how much you've spent. What pushes this place above 3 stars is the service. When I walked in it was just such a happy, welcoming place. It's like walking into Cheers. It's obvious this place has many regulars who are known by the staff.  I put my food and coffee on a small table and realized that I needed napkins. As I approached the counter one of the staff caught my eye and say, "Oh, napkins are over there."  I sat back down and wondered if there was free WiFi, and the WiFi login said I could get a code on my receipt, which I had earlier declined to take. So, I walked back to the counter and asked the same staff person, "What am I thinking now?" He goes to the register, and prints out a receipt.  I tip no matter what, but these guys made it worth it.
author: Jason G.

description: Ok place, nothing special. The Internet is timed, that's fine if it actually worked...grab and go kind of place.  There are better places in the area, I went here to go on the interest for a couple of hours.  No luck.
author: Wayne T.

description: Super potent and tasty espresso shots.  Will be back for sure if in the area.
author: Andy S.

description:
3.5 stars, but I'll round up.

My large iced mocha was alright, but could've definitely been darker and stronger. However, the employees are nice here, and put up with me changing my order 3 times (before they made it of course). Prices are good, and the spot is clean and cute. Coffee drinks, tea, pastries and more!

Parking can be tough unless it's a weekday morning.

$4.00 minimum for cards.
author: Elaine H.

description:
Decent coffee, fair prices, poor attitude.  

The coffee is about $2 and they have a pretty standard coffee menu.  They do sell beans as well, at a really fair price too ($12/lb).   The place is pretty clean and warm feeling. 

However, the customer service was just rude.  The first person we spoke with was friendly, but the two other workers really seemed like they didn't want to be there or to help customers.  Oh well.

Notes:
-You can't have your coffee in a mug (for here).  To-go paper cups only.
author: Samantha L.

description: I like this place.  It's bright and comfy.  Coffee is good. They have free and fast wifi.  What else can you ask for?
author: Perry L.

description:
This place has plusses: Great food, decent coffee, really great atmosphere to read or work in.

There is one big minus for me:_terrible_ espresso.  I don't think I've had a decent shot from any of their baristas.  I can see the shot's sputtering, inconsistent flow as its being pulled: a sure sign that either the grind, the roast, or the tamping is wrong.
author: Chris B.

description: Decent coffee with sub-par service.  I asked for steamed soy milk with my coffee and the barista handed me a cold carton of soy milk.
author: Alice L.

description:
Good coffee drinks, decent breakfast foods, friendly staff. I always come here when I'm getting my car serviced at Toyota and its never bad.

4 stars for the food/drinks, 5 stars for the friendly staff.
author: Amanda W.

description:
This little place on Clement is lively, and where locals go. The service is outstanding and atmosphere is friendly, clean and busy. Prices are reasonable, they have everything that Peets or Starbucks has, only they are local and family owned. Internet access is available as well as their own prepaid coffee (or gift) cards. 

Located on a really quaint spot of Clement near 3rd Ave not far from Arguello. This part of Arguello is a neat little neighborhood area with shops and restaurants. 

Next time you are in the Richmond District check out Cumaica. They take ATM/credit cards. Cafe Latte is good, so is their baked goods, like the pumpkin bread.
author: Jonathan F.

description: First time I went here they didn't even get my order right. Second time I went here the lady behind the counter talkin shit in Spanish and then gave me a fake ass smile for changing my order to iced instead of hot..... Bitch
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
love this coffee place!

yummy delicious soy lattes i get every AM!
staff is super nice and they remember me and my drinks everytime i go.  even when i was away for a year and came back, the staff still remembered me.

good study place, yummy pastries and bfast bagel sandwiches!

only neg is that they close so early! at least they open at 6am to make up for that

this is definitely my go to cafe when im back in the hood!
author: Linda T.

description: I liked this place at first because they made good mochas. That was about a year and a half ago. Overtime it seems like everything has been getting bad. Quality of coffee AND service. Up until today I was willing to close my eyes on the very crappy service and rude employees to still be able to get my white mochas, but today just did it for me. First my drink was nowhere near hot. It wasn't even warm and this has happened before where they didn't have the patience to heat up the milk for long enough and tried to give me an attitude when I asked if it could be a little hotter. When the same thing happened today, first the barista gave me an attitude. Then she asked me if my coffee was hot enough after heating it up for about 10 secs, when my answer was no again, she rolled her eyes and proceeded to PUT MY DRINK IN THE MICROWAVE!!!! WHY WOULD I WALK TO A COFFEE SHOP, PAY FOR MY COFFEE, ONLY TO HAVE IT MICROWAVED?!?  I am beyond myself. If you are ready to have your day ruined so early in the morning by terrible behavior and bad coffee, this is the place to go to people.
author: Aby M.

description:
Cute coffee shop with a friendly staff.

It's a very cozy place for an afternoon coffee, might even consider coming here to do my studying since it's a cute local coffee shop. 

Their macaroons are pretty yummy too.
author: Cara N.

description:
According to the sign, this place markets itself as an artsy cafe. The interior is nice with some modern art items on the wall.

I stopped by one day after lunch during the week to order a coffee to battle food coma. As I recall, there's only one brew instead of having s choice of pots to select from. The coffee was definitely A-OK, enough taste and not weak.

They even have a bench in front with a hole serving as a cup holder for those who want to enjoy their drink outside.
author: H K.

description: The people are super friendly. I ordered a small vanilla latte, like I normally do at all coffee places, and this one was the best. I've been to a lot of coffee places in the city since I travel around the city for work but this has been the best. They have a lot of regulars and someday I hope to be one!
author: Brittney M.

description: Cumaica is a nice little coffee spot tucked away in the inner Richmond.  It is right by my therapist's office, so super convenient for me whenever I visit this part of town.  Their iced tea is probably one of the best I've had (I don't usually do iced tea b/c I can never find a good one, theirs hits the spot (refreshing and I think they make it well).  They usually do small samples of their pastries as well.
author: Darya L.

description: A sucker for cute cafes, I took my mom here and got her a chai latte and me a mexican mocha. Both delightful, not too sweet. We also split a almond scone, which was womp womp because it was all flour, no almonds, and it wasn't solid enough, if that makes any sense.. like powdery instead of crumby? The place was also full of a wide range of people (old, young, distinctly foreign...), if you like variety.
author: Vivian H.

description:
I am attracted to Cumaica physically. It's a cozy space, very comfortable to hang out, but coffee-wise, it comes on strong but is a husk..

        Cumaica-     "What, what are you saying? I thought you liked me."
        Me-               "I like your space. You're  good-
                                looking.  You're strong. But your coffee and espresso-
                                that's all they are-strong. I need something more-some 
                                kind of taste, flavor... You don't taste like
                                anything."
         Cumaica-    "But I'm strong, look!" (shows me his muscles).
         Me-              "I know...you are...I'm sorry, this just isn't working.  I think 
                                I'm going to try down the street, that Danube place."
         Cumaica-    "I'm too strong for you? Go ahead, there are women
                                who can handle me. Go get your pansy-ass French
                                dishwater."
         Me-               "Yeah, I think will. Sorry... tenga un buen dia. Husk."
author: Lame Lake Meese Z.

description:
Really solid coffee here and good baked goods. In fact, they carry my favorite scones in SF.

Nice, helpful staff and located in a great part of Clement Street. Always a favorite.
author: P L.

description: This is the best in the Cumaica chain regarding consistency. It's currently my favorite coffee house. Try the peanut butter protein bar. Parking is always easy for me because I usually come during the afternoon however that is changing. A big Ace Hardware store is opening up next door so those parking spots will be disappearing. Unfortunately for me if I can't park, I don't buy. I just hope Ace will close at 6pm so at least there will be parking between 6 and 8.
author: Stanley J.

description:
Nice and friendly staff. Nice corner locations with big sunny windows. REALLY bad music was playing... country radio pop. The coffee themed artwork could have been purchased at Target. Small selection of refrigerated packaged snacks, salads and sandwiches. 

Pretty large selection of coffees and teas and very reasonable prices.  Take it to go, or at least don't plan on doing an entire afternoon of work there.
author: Carrie G.

description:
Basic, solid, coffee house.  With yummy, healthier-side treats.  Great neighborhood, too.  So, if you don't like the selection of pastries, just take a little walk around the block and I'm sure you can find something satisfying.

The people working behind the counter are usually very sweet and I've never really been here when it's been incredibly busy.  The drinks are served HOT.  I wish they would add bacon to their breakfast bagels.
author: Lauren R.

description: Neither lady who took my order spoke English so I had to give it a third time to the manager and they still brought me the wrong pastry. When I finally did get my banana bread it tasted like a dried horse poop cake and my cappuccino was cold. Thankfully they had the grace to give me a full cash refund or I might have had to go Wayne Brady on that azz
author: Jasper P.

description: Best coffee in the Inner Richmond and one of my favorite coffee spots in San Francisco! The coffee is amazing and the staff is really friendly. They remember their customers' names and orders and always greet you with a smile. I couldn't ask for more on a Monday morning at 7 am!
author: Lauren C.

description: Finally We got a really good coffee in our neiborhood 5 stars guys for sure!!!!
author: Denis A.

description: This place is awesome. I've been coming here for a few years now...they know what i want in my soy espresso. Fast and Friendly. Thank you for being in the richmond district! You guys rock.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Caffeine al fresco.

Gorgeous day. Tables outside. Free internet. Laptop. Rather good Americano with sugar free vanilla syrup.

Less than three bucks. Got more than three bucks out of it.
author: Jason B.

description: 1 star & less. Any business that charged $.25 ATM fee when you purchase anything under $4 is a garbage, sleezy, & doomed business. I & all my friends won't be coming back here any longer. I MISS Martha Bros Coffee!!!!
author: Cee B.

description: Formerly called Martha's Brothers, Cumaica is an adorable coffee shop with roots in the Nicaraguan plantations. The coffee here is definitely not your Starbucks and the service is far above. At Cumaica, they do not write your name on your coffee cup. Rather, they hand you your coffee along with that warm family feeling. My favorite blend is still their North Beach Blend. Places like this add so much value to the neighborhood. Thank you Cumaica!
author: Sue L.

description: Great little neighborhood cafe with very friendly, excellent service -- unusual in today's harried world. Love their delicious chai lattes!  They also have a nice selection of pasta salads, pastries and yogurt with fresh fruit that I often stop by to get for lunch when I'm on the run.
author: Ashley A.

description: One of my favorite coffee spots in Inner Richmond. Great coffee and reasonably priced! Staff is also nice and friendly.
author: Bridget B.

description: Been here two times so far. Great chai-- hot and frappe styles. Bright and comfy.
author: Vivian L.

description: I'm basing this review, solely on the Mexican Mocha. Their mocha has a real chocolate taste, not like most coffee places that serve a mocha and it's all fake tasting with a possible unappealing after taste.  No, this mocha is the real deal with cinnamon to make it perfectly Mexican ;)  The cinnamon isn't shy either, enjoy.
author: Casie M.

description: Excellent non-fat decaf latte at a great price!
author: Carl C.

description: Great coffee, good prices. No snobbery or hipper-than-thou attitude here; Cumaica is my personal favorite in terms of Inner Richmond coffee joints.
author: Aaron J.

description: coffee is alright. nothing special. i did spy a lot of goodies that range from sandwiches to snacks, desserts. staff was friendly. had seating when i went on a weekday afternoon. with windows and sun.
author: Vicki T.

description: I like this place, good coffee and friendly staff, relaxed atmosphere.  Only gripes are that the internet is always going down (now it hasn't been working for days and they don't fix it!) and as other people have pointed out the door has been broken forever and it gets cold when the weather is cold outside.
author: Ritch G.

description: Great coffee, and even better ICED coffee. But please, fix your unreliable Wi-Fi because I've attempted too many times to do work here and had to walk out so frustrated. I really do like the coffee and clean environment - I just wish I could actually get my coffee and do some work there, too.
author: Linda T.

description: Good espresso, really yummy breakfast burritos, and coffee crumb cake, Service is excellent and the outdoor seating rocks!
author: Christina L.

description: The music was very loud.  I asked an employee to turn it down, and this worked for a little while, but after a few minutes she turned it back up again.  This left me with the impression that this cafe was run for the benefit of the employees rather than the customers.
author: Alison P.

description:
We were fans up until a few months back when they started putting out the stampt app where you get a free drink for every 9 you purchase. Well that would be great if they offered it to you, but they have never offered to me or anyone I know. 

We would have been bothered by this, but it made me realize I can get the same quality coffee down the street but with friendlier owners and staff. I guess I try again, but I've been disappointed now.
author: m K.

description:
Perhaps the service was poor today, but the staff was quite uninterested in doing their job beyond the minimum. They didn't bus tables, several of which were covered with crumbs. They didn't steam my tea in its bag with boiling water. 
The carrot pound cake was not pound cake but a quick bread obviously made with vegetable oil not butter. 
Terribly mediocre, and expensive.
author: Daphne X.

description: Great little coffee shop, but they really need to fix the door. It stays really cold inside because the door doesn't close on its own. Otherwise highly recommended.
author: John-Mark I.

description: This is my favorite cafe because the service is always friendly and efficient (no, I do not want to wait 10 minutes while you make a damn latte, Blue Bottle maniacs).  When I order an iced latte, it always has an abundant amount of ice in it.  You'd be surprised how many SF coffee spots can't master the iced latte.
author: A W.

description: Don't mess around with people's coffee in the morning!  This guy makes the coffee tells me all the drinks there have only 2 shots no matter what size.  I ordered a medium americano and he gave me a large cup with 2 shots in it.  I told him it tastes like water down coffee. He said you need to paid $1.20 for an extra shot.  Are you freaking kidding me! I will never go back there, the service and the worker's attitude are incredibly lousy.
author: Sammi T.
